Class Fluava

java.lang.Object
dev.goldmensch.fluava.Fluava
public class Fluava extends Object

The main entrypoint for fluava.

To use this library, you have to create an instance of this class and pass a "fallback" locale, which will be used if a certain key isn't found for a requested locale.

Example

// create Fluava instance with as English as the fallback locale
Fluava fluava = new Fluava(Locale.ENGLISH);

// get the bundle with basename app
Bundle appBundle = fluava.loadBundle("app");

// get message out of bundle
String failMessage = appBundle.apply(Locale.GERMAN, "fail", Map.of("msg", err.msg()));

    • builder

      public static FluavaBuilder builder(Fluava fluava)
      Creates a new FluavaBuilder preset with the options from the provided Fluava instance. This can be used to crate "sub instances" which allows to override certain functions/add new ones.
      Parameters:
      fluava - the "parent" Fluava instance
      Returns:
      the FluavaBuilder preset with the options from the provided instance

    • loadBundle

      public Bundle loadBundle(String base)

      Creates a new Bundle with the given base path, that will be loaded from the classpath.

      If the bundle is in a subdirectory/subpackage, you can add it to the base of the bundle.

      For example, a bundle called "msg" sits in a subdirectly called "localization". The base path you have to use is "localization/msg".

      You can also set a base path that is applied to all bundles via FluavaBuilder.bundleRoot(String).

      Returns:
      the newly creates Bundle
